quoteFirst: on Sunday, April 6, a reconnoitering party was sent out from Prentiss’ division to explore a small wagon trail to the front. quoteLast: There followed an engagement with the pickets, commanded by Major Hardcastle, from Wood’s brigade of Hardee’s corps.

quoteFirst: I begged Him, if it pleased Him, to give me sleep, and wake me at five. I laid down, slept, and when I awoke, looked at my watch, which was just
quoteLast: . I felt, and still feel my obligations to the Lord, and am resolved to commit myself to His guidance.--My birthday. I awoke a little after three, and arose at half-past four, with these words upon my mind, 'Who will consecrate his services this day unto the Lord?' My heart responds, 'I will.
title: Religion in Earnest: A Memorial of Mrs. Mary Lyth, of York
author: Lyth, J. (John), 1821-1886

quoteFirst: To the Highland Brigade,[64] under General Alison, fell the task of carrying the lines to the left. The first shots were fired at them at
quoteLast: from an Egyptian picket posted about 150 yards in front of the intrenchments, then visible 300 yards distant from the Highlanders. Immediately afterwards the enemy opened with artillery and then with musketry.
title: The Egyptian campaigns, 1882 to 1885
author: Royle, Charles, 1882-1936

quoteFirst: At 7 p.m. we moved forward again and at 11.30 p.m. reached and occupied shell holes just west of Monchy, very fortunately shown on the map as Orange Hill. On our arrival here orders were received from the 9th Brigade to co-operate with other units of the Brigade and attack at
quoteLast: A conference of Company Commanders was hastily called when the plan of attack was discussed and instructions quickly detailed, and at 12.10 midnight, companies had moved off by platoons to take up assembly positions in the jumping-off trench held by the Royal Canadian Regiment.
title: The 116th Battalion in France
author: Allen, E. P. S. (Evelyn Prestwood Seymour), 1885-1972

quoteFirst: Light a pipe and sit down in a comfortable place, if such there be, and leave the sinner alone until the spirit does move her to stir. At some time or other, varying from
quoteLast: hours, she will want the lure badly enough. Then let her come for it. Keep her waiting on or stooping at the lure till she has had a good dose of it, and if she goes off to perch again, wait again till she will work for her living.
